bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 131 (Friday, July 24, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. KENDRA S. HORN of Oklahoma:H.R. 7776.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3[Page H3859]

item.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H3906)
Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

summary.text:
Children's Mental Health Care Access Act of 2020

This bill authorizes child care providers to use payments received through the Child Care and Development Fund for mental health supports for children in the provider's care and employees of the provider.

bill.title: Children’s Mental Health Care Access Act of 2020

item.title: Children’s Mental Health Care Access Act of 2020
Children’s Mental Health Care Access Act of 2020

To permit child care providers that receive payment for services provided under the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 to use a portion of such payment to purchase mental health supports necessary to protect the health of participating children and child care workers.

latestAction.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H3906)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
